conclusion: Analyze the behavior of ions as they pass through the velocity selector, magnetic analyzer, and deflection system.
The velocity selector uses both electric and magnetic fields to select ions with a specific velocity.
The electric field E is directed vertically upwards, and the magnetic field B is directed outward perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
Force on an ion due to the electric field is given by F_E = qE.
Force on an ion due to the magnetic field is given by F_B = qvB.
For ions to pass through the velocity selector without deflection, qE = qvB implies v = E/B.
The magnetic analyzer selects ions based on their charge-to-mass ratio.
Radius of circular path for ions in a magnetic field is given by r = mv/qB.
The analyzer selects ions that pass through apertures at M and N, traveling along a path with radius between R1 and R2.
Charge-to-mass ratio is determined by R1 <= mv/qB <= R2, substituting v = E/B gives R1 <= mE/qB^2 <= R2.
The deflection system uses both electric and magnetic fields to deflect ions onto the wafer.
Deflection angle due to electric field is given by α_E = qEL/mv^2, substituting v = E/B gives α_E = qBL/mE.
Deflection angle due to magnetic field is given by α_B = qBL/mv, substituting v = E/B gives α_B = qB^2L/mE.
Total deflection angle α is the sum of deflections due to electric and magnetic fields: α = qBL(1 + B)/mE.
Velocity of ions after velocity selector is v = E/B.
Charge-to-mass ratio of selected ions is q/m = E/B^2R.
